Class Board

java.lang.Object
Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
The Board class implements methods to move players across the gameboard and display results to the user.
Author:
Kevin Courey

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.String[][] contents
    Stores the contents of the gameboard into a two dimensional array.
    private static int length
    Stores the length of the gameboard.
    private static int width
    Stores the width of the gameboard.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor Description
    Board()
    This method constructs a board with a default length, width and content storage size.
    Board​(int length, int width)
    This method constructs a board with a specified length, width and content storage size.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static void displayBoard​(Board numBoard, Board gameBoard)
    This method displays the contents of two boards to the user.
    void fillBoard()
    This method fills the gameboard (from top to bottom) with each square/tile's respective number.
    java.lang.String getContents​(int x, int y)
    This method retrieves the contents of the square at coordinates (x, y) on the gameboard that invokes this method.
    static int getLength()
    This method retrieves the length of the gameboard.
    static int getWidth()
    This method retrieves the width of the gameboard.
    void movePlayer​(Player player)
    This method sets a player to their appropriate location on the gameboard by using their x and y coordinates, calculated from within the player class.
    void placeLadders()
    This method sets ladder heads and bases on the gameboard.
    void placeSnakes()
    This method sets snake heads and tails on the gameboard.
    void removePlayer​(Player player)
    This method replaces the player's previous position with null.
    void setContents​(int x, int y, java.lang.String contents)
    This method sets the contents of the square at coordinates (x, y) on the gameboard that invokes this method.
    static void setLength​(int length)
    This method sets the length of the gameboard.
    static void setWidth​(int width)
    This method sets the width of the gameboard.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • length

      Stores the length of the gameboard.

      private static int width
      Stores the width of the gameboard.

    • contents

      private java.lang.String[][] contents
      Stores the contents of the gameboard into a two dimensional array.

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      This method constructs a board with a default length, width and content storage size.

    • Board

      public Board​(int length, int width)
      This method constructs a board with a specified length, width and content storage size.
      Parameters:
      length - The length of the gameboard.
      width - The width of the gameboard.

  • Method Details

    • getLength

      public static int getLength()
      This method retrieves the length of the gameboard.
      Returns:
      The length of the gameboard.

    • getWidth

      public static int getWidth()
      This method retrieves the width of the gameboard.
      Returns:
      The width of the gameboard.

    • getContents

      public java.lang.String getContents​(int x, int y)
      This method retrieves the contents of the square at coordinates (x, y) on the gameboard that invokes this method.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate on the gameboard.
      y - The y-coordinate on the gameboard.
      Returns:
      The content located at position (x, y) on the gameboard that invokes this method.

    • setLength

      public static void setLength​(int length)
      This method sets the length of the gameboard.
      Parameters:
      length - The length of the gameboard.

    • setWidth

      public static void setWidth​(int width)
      This method sets the width of the gameboard.
      Parameters:
      width - The width of the gameboard.

    • setContents

      public void setContents​(int x, int y, java.lang.String contents)
      This method sets the contents of the square at coordinates (x, y) on the gameboard that invokes this method.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate on the gameboard.
      y - The y-coordinate on the gameboard.
      contents - The content to be placed at location (x, y) on the gameboard that invokes this method.

    • placeSnakes

      public void placeSnakes()
      This method sets snake heads and tails on the gameboard.

    • placeLadders

      public void placeLadders()
      This method sets ladder heads and bases on the gameboard.

    • fillBoard

      public void fillBoard()
      This method fills the gameboard (from top to bottom) with each square/tile's respective number. Once completed, replace the contents that occupy the snakes and ladders squares and with their approriate snake and ladder identifiers.

    • displayBoard

      public static void displayBoard​(Board numBoard, Board gameBoard)
      This method displays the contents of two boards to the user. One board contains the numbers, as well as the snake and ladder identifiers. The second board contains the player psoitions.
      Parameters:
      numBoard - The board which contains the square numbers, as well as the snake and ladder identifiers.
      gameBoard - The board which contains the player locations.

    • movePlayer

      public void movePlayer​(Player player)
      This method sets a player to their appropriate location on the gameboard by using their x and y coordinates, calculated from within the player class.
      Parameters:
      player - The player being moved across the gameboard.

    • removePlayer

      public void removePlayer​(Player player)
      This method replaces the player's previous position with null.
      Parameters:
      player - The player being moved across the gameboard.
